To see what's in your google drive use gs_ls().

```{r, include=F}
quest_res_list <- gs_title("Femmes Questionnaire Responses")
quest_res_df <- for_gs_sheet <- gs_read(quest_res_list)
```

Changing column names:
```{r}
names(quest_res_df) = c("time_stamp", "num_siblings", "fav_color", "height", "shoe_size", "movie_genre", "fav_chocolate", "fav_pet", "fav_season", "fav_num")
#View(quest_res_df)
```

#### Correlation between shoe number and number of siblings? Too much?

```{r}
ggplot(quest_res_df) + 
  geom_point(aes(x = num_siblings, y = shoe_size)) + 
  labs(x = "Number of Siblings", y = "Shoe Size")
```

#### Favorite season

```{r}
ggplot(quest_res_df) + 
  geom_bar(aes(x = fav_season)) +
  labs(x = "Favorite Season")
```
